bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas, July 31, 1952

div1.p: Hench sends Rojas enclosures to review concerning the history of yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas, July 31, 1952
div1.opener:
July 31, 1952
Senorita Maria Teresa Rojas
Quinta San Jose
Redencion
Marianao, Habana
Cuba
My dear Tina:
div1.p:
Permit me to send you the enclosures and I would
appreciate it if you would review them at your
earliest convenience.

Have you ever received a copy of Kelly's book,
“Walter Reed and Yellow Fever,” of General
Truby's book on “A Memoir of Walter Reed - the
Yellow Fever Episode,” or of the Senate Docu-
ment 822, a compilation of the papers of the
U. S. Army Yellow Fever Commission? These
books are hard to find but I do think that
you should have them in your possession and
I should like to try to get them for you and
present them to you. I may have an extra
copy of one - the Truby book, although it is
sold out and difficult to obtain. Every now
and then I see one of the other two named in a
second-hand book catalog.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
Enclosures
